description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4b1bc","text":"Here, a highly efficient method for differentiating monocytes/macrophages from hiPSC is described. The process utilizes commercially-available materials to derive CD34+ progenitor cells that are apically released from a hemogenic endothelium. Subsequently, the hemogenic endothelium gives rise to highly pure (\u003e95%), CD34-CD14+ monocytes in 19-23 days and yields more monocytes by day 35 when compared to previous methods. These monocytes are further differentiated to macrophages after 7 days. The efficient workflow and increase in monocyte output boost feasibility for high throughput studies and enables clinical-scale iPSC-derived manufacturing processes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6trfm","text":"Summary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l6ml","text":"Here, a highly efficient method for differentiating monocytes is described. The process utilizes commercially-available materials to derive CD34+ progenitor cells that are apically released from a hemogenic endothelium. Subsequently, the hemogenic endothelium gives rise to highly pure (\u003e95%), CD34-CD14+ monocytes in 19-23 days and yields more monocytes by day 35 when compared to previous methods. The efficient workflow and increase in monocyte output boost feasibility for high throughput studies and enables clinical-scale iPSC-derived manufacturing processes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Differentiation of iPSCs to Hematopoietic Progenitor Cells,Differentiation of HPC to monocytes,Differentiation of iPSC-derived monocytes into macrophages,Macrophage activation,ASAPCRN

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Differentiation of iPSCs to Hematopoietic Progenitor Cells (HPCs)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bhjtb","text":"Start with large cultures of pluripotent stem cells around 50–70% confluence cultured on Matrigel hESC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Differentiation of iPSCs to Hematopoietic Progenitor Cells (HPCs)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ibdc","text":"Coat 6-well plates with fresh Matrigel ( /plate) 1 h to   at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"141i8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"6CD65B102F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"773143E02F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"811527F02F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ibgn","text":"Prepare iPSC maintenance medium (mTeSRplus) with   Rock inhibitor (concentration depending on your line). Add   of medium supplemented with rock inhibitor to each well of the Matrigel coated 6-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":110,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"8AC244902F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"926CDA702F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Differentiation of iPSCs to Hematopoietic Progenitor Cells (HPCs)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"be8sn","text":"Prepare 96-well plate for counting cell clusters. Using a 5 ml pipette, gently pipette up and down 2-3 times in order to achieve clusters of ~ 50-100 cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"26cs3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"C50B13202F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9jarj","text":"Pipette   of cell cluster mixture into each well of the 96-well plate (n = 3 wells) for counting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7imv3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cnelf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"CCA507302F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":39},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":214}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"494md","text":"Important! It is recommended to pipett   of cells with a p20 pipette to get a more accurate representation of cell cluster size that will be plated. Use of a p10 pipettor may triturate cells too far. Additionally,   volume can be adjusted if there are too many cell clusters to easily and accurately count or cell cluster number.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"D8A478402F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"DF6EE7502F5F11EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}}}}

steps.section: Differentiation of iPSCs to Hematopoietic Progenitor Cells (HPCs)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eai0d","text":"Count all cell clusters of ~100 cells (100–200 μm diameter). Determine # of clusters per μL (total count of correct sized clusters in 3 wells/15 μL total cell cluster suspension). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhsfv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"497vh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8e9p6","text":"Important! Do not count clusters that are too big or too small. Clusters that are too small can be ignored as they likely will not survive passage, and the few that remain will not differentiate. However, clusters that are too large should be avoided. If there are many large clusters, triturate the cell suspension and recount. It can also be helpful to let larger clusters settle to the bottom of the tube if there are only several in suspension and trituration would create too many smaller clusters.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Differentiation of iPSCs to Hematopoietic Progenitor Cells (HPCs)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3dpc8","text":"Using cluster #/μL calculations, plate 20–40 clusters per well. The goal is to produce 10–20 surviving clusters of ~100 cells each per well the next day. Swirl plate in incubator to evenly distribute the clusters throughout the plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk07s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8oc58","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"bc4sp","text":"Important! After counting, flick or invert cell suspension tube as clusters of cells will have settled to the bottom. To guarantee success on preliminary runs, it can be helpful to plate several wells of various densities from 20 to 40 clusters per well. If your cell line is particularly robust, you can plate lower densities such as 10–20 clusters per well. With quick-growing cell lines, you will also want to err toward lower densities as these colonies will be larger than slow-growing iPSC lines.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Differentiation of iPSCs to Hematopoietic Progenitor Cells (HPCs)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dfusg","text":"24 h after plating, count colonies and choose wells to begin with. Do not blindly start differentiations in all wells. Choose only wells with 10–20 undifferentiated iPSC clusters of ~100 cells each. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dc5p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"87he4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l2qs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"59ufp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"0BCEAF444AA011EF85B70A58A9FEAC02","height":413,"id":486651,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"aaeav\",\"text\":\"Representative morphology of KOLF iPSC line at day 0. Due to ROCK inhibitor, colonies might look with more loose packing. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"KOLF day 0.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q5hmbg9cx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q5h5bg9cx.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/q5h4bg9cx.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"3o44p","text":"Critical step: Smaller clusters may be ignored and these wells may still be used (if all clusters are small but density is good, cells can be cultured in mTeSR plus 1–2 days prior to starting experimentation). Wells that have 2 or more large clusters of iPSCs cannot be used as these larger clusters will interfere with proper differentiation. Wells with more than 30 clusters cannot be used as these will result in significantly decreased yield. Wells with less than 10 clusters may be used, but final yield will be diminished.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1qods","text":"48 h later, remove all medium A and add   Medium B (1:200 dilution of supplement B into basal medium) per well (Day 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2la7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"7370C4002F6011EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

steps.section: Differentiation of iPSCs to Hematopoietic Progenitor Cells (HPCs)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cid47","text":"Repeat addition of   medium B every 48 h three times (Day 6, 8, 10).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e4890","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ke7d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9piok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"7DB677202F6011EE80959781AABFF598","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"59lcs","text":"Important! Do not remove medium B during the differentiation process ever, the differentiating cells are secreting crucial cytokines into the medium and removal of these will hinder the differentiation process. Over the course of differentiation, the phenol red in the medium will begin to turn yellow—this is expected. By day 6–7 you should be able to see round, phase-bright cell clusters forming within the endothelial cell layers. If these do not occur, the differentiation is not likely to be successful. Common issues are that clusters were originally plated at too high a density or too close to each other.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
